title: Baruwal R Package
text: Load common library need install fbd R package package run. Now, install R package: Let us download data package: Lets load data get started: Now, lets simulate data using function simulation: Output: #data Visualization using function treeplot  Output:  Compare simulated data emperical data Create dataframe store datas #Using function comparision  #Calculating effect_size
code: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.1 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.5     ✓ purrr   0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble  3.1.6     ✓ dplyr   1.0.7 ## ✓ tidyr   1.1.4     ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr   2.0.2     ✓ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag() library(ggplot2) install.packages("FossilSim") ## Installing package into '/tmp/RtmpZenVbZ/temp_libpath5f186134561d' ## (as 'lib' is unspecified) library(FossilSim) install.packages("devtools") ## Installing package into '/tmp/RtmpZenVbZ/temp_libpath5f186134561d' ## (as 'lib' is unspecified) library(devtools) ## Loading required package: usethis devtools::install_github("simranbaru/R_Package_Baruwal") ## Using github PAT from envvar GITHUB_PAT ## Downloading GitHub repo simranbaru/R_Package_Baruwal@HEAD ##       checking for file ‘/tmp/RtmpehGQ4g/remotes62ba4113509/simranbaru-R_package_Baruwal-806747e/DESCRIPTION’ ...     [32m✓ [39m   [38;5;247mchecking for file ‘/tmp/RtmpehGQ4g/remotes62ba4113509/simranbaru-R_package_Baruwal-806747e/DESCRIPTION’ [39m [36m [39m ##      [38;5;247m─ [39m [38;5;247m   [39m [38;5;247mpreparing ‘BaruwalRPackage’: [39m [36m [39m ##        checking DESCRIPTION meta-information ...     [32m✓ [39m   [38;5;247mchecking DESCRIPTION meta-information [39m [36m [39m ##      [38;5;247m─ [39m [38;5;247m   [39m [38;5;247mchecking for LF line-endings in source and make files and shell scripts [39m [36m [39m ##      [38;5;247m─ [39m [38;5;247m   [39m [38;5;247mchecking for empty or unneeded directories [39m [36m [39m ##  [38;5;247m─ [39m [38;5;247m   [39m [38;5;247mlooking to see if a ‘data/datalist’ file should be added [39m [36m [39m ##      [38;5;247m─ [39m [38;5;247m   [39m [38;5;247mbuilding ‘BaruwalRPackage_0.0.0.9000.tar.gz’ [39m [36m [39m ##         ## ## Installing package into '/tmp/RtmpZenVbZ/temp_libpath5f186134561d' ## (as 'lib' is unspecified) library(BaruwalRPackage) devtools::load_all() ## ℹ Loading BaruwalRPackage download.file(url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/simranbaru/R_package_Baruwal/master/data/ants_timevary.log", destfile = "/cloud/project/vignettes/ants_timevary.log") ants <- read_tsv("/cloud/project/vignettes/ants_timevary.log") ## Rows: 20 Columns: 1557 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "\t" ## dbl (1557): Iteration, Posterior, Likelihood, Prior, alpha_cytb[1], alpha_cy... ##  ## ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ## ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. ants ## # A tibble: 20 × 1,557 ##    Iteration Posterior Likelihood  Prior `alpha_cytb[1]` `alpha_cytb[2]` ##        <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>  <dbl>           <dbl>           <dbl> ##  1         0  -869910.   -866709. -3200.           0.792           0.256 ##  2        10  -665628.   -662948. -2679.           0.238           0.245 ##  3        20  -645766.   -644125  -1640.           0.152           0.270 ##  4        30  -641394.   -640495.  -899.           0.154           0.269 ##  5        40  -639094.   -638700.  -394.           0.159           0.279 ##  6        50  -638528.   -638129.  -399.           0.149           0.276 ##  7        60  -638197.   -637788.  -409.           0.158           0.275 ##  8        70  -637743.   -637260.  -483.           0.151           0.281 ##  9        80  -637465.   -637026   -439.           0.148           0.276 ## 10        90  -637443.   -636947.  -496.           0.154           0.280 ## 11       100  -637373.   -636928.  -445.           0.152           0.278 ## 12       110  -637419.   -636925.  -494.           0.150           0.273 ## 13       120  -637350.   -636879.  -471.           0.151           0.268 ## 14       130  -637351.   -636859.  -493.           0.152           0.277 ## 15       140  -637294.   -636851.  -443.           0.150           0.282 ## 16       150  -637245.   -636841.  -404.           0.149           0.282 ## 17       160  -637267.   -636829.  -437.           0.153           0.273 ## 18       170  -637314.   -636824.  -490.           0.148           0.269 ## 19       180  -637325.   -636824.  -501.           0.151           0.287 ## 20       190  -637318.   -636811.  -507.           0.151           0.273 ## # … with 1,551 more variables: alpha_cytb[3] <dbl>, alpha_cytb[4] <dbl>, ## #   alpha_cytb[5] <dbl>, alpha_cytb[6] <dbl>, alpha_cytb[7] <dbl>, ## #   alpha_cytb[8] <dbl>, alpha_cytb[9] <dbl>, branch_rates[1] <dbl>, ## #   branch_rates[2] <dbl>, branch_rates[3] <dbl>, branch_rates[4] <dbl>, ## #   branch_rates[5] <dbl>, branch_rates[6] <dbl>, branch_rates[7] <dbl>, ## #   branch_rates[8] <dbl>, branch_rates[9] <dbl>, branch_rates[10] <dbl>, ## #   branch_rates[11] <dbl>, branch_rates[12] <dbl>, branch_rates[13] <dbl>, … lambda <- ants$speciation_rate mu <- ants$extinction_rate psi <- ants$psi i = 1 trees <- vector() while (i <= 20) { trees[i] <- c(BaruwalRPackage::simulation(n=10, numbsim=1, lambda[i], mu[i], psi[i], frac = .01)) print(trees[i]) i <- i + 1 } ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 3198 tips and 3197 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t16_2, t521_1, t24_3, t682_1, t542_1, t1049_4, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 1318 tips and 1317 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t621_4, t599_1, t794_2, t68_1, t779_1, t9_5, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 413 tips and 412 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t863_1, t649_2, t595_1, t901_1, t909_1, t380_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 118 tips and 117 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t974_1, t251_1, t34_1, t47_1, t74_1, t940_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 24 tips and 23 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t215_1, t63_1, t764_1, t528_1, t685_1, t955_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 14 tips and 13 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t866_1, t489_1, t454_1, t515_1, t786_1, t829_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 12 tips and 11 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t502_1, t826_1, t155_1, t897_1, t1000_1, t83_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 18 tips and 17 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t623_1, t234_1, t882_2, t915_1, t635_1, t53_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 11 tips and 10 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t428_1, t200_1, t375_1, t881_1, t129_1, t178_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 13 tips and 12 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t671_1, t212_1, t920_1, t655_1, t256_1, t83_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 11 tips and 10 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t786_1, t127_1, t637_1, t153_1, t57_1, t282_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 11 tips and 10 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t818_1, t480_1, t149_1, t392_1, t902_1, t532_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 15 tips and 14 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t365_1, t248_1, t63_1, t989_1, t280_1, t853_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 12 tips and 11 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t293_1, t675_1, t720_1, t748_1, t240_1, t499_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 12 tips and 11 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t804_1, t978_1, t62_1, t126_1, t762_1, t760_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 11 tips and 10 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t15_1, t635_1, t637_1, t473_1, t36_1, t534_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 12 tips and 11 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t458_1, t232_1, t48_1, t498_1, t372_1, t298_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 11 tips and 10 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t557_1, t266_1, t627_1, t455_1, t675_1, t661_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 11 tips and 10 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t567_1, t648_1, t1023_1, t491_1, t171_1, t292_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. ##  ## [[1]] ##  ## Phylogenetic tree with 12 tips and 11 internal nodes. ##  ## Tip labels: ##   t853_1, t705_1, t861_1, t517_1, t72_1, t526_1, ... ##  ## Rooted; includes branch lengths. i = 1 simulated <- vector() for(i in 1:20){   simulated[i] <- c(trees[[i]]$root.edge) } emperical_data <- ants$origin_time meane <- mean(emperical_data) means <- mean(simulated) i = 1 for (i in 1:20) { BaruwalRPackage::treeplot(i) } treeplot(1) ## NULL datas <- data.frame(simulated, emperical_data, meane, means) comparision(datasdf = datas) effect_size(datasdf = datas) ## [1] 0.9082169

text: n Number extant sampled tips numbsim Number trees simulate lambda Vector speciation rates, rate entry speciation rate prior (ancestral) time timesi. mu Extinction rate psi Fossil sampling rate frac extant tip tree n/frac
